description: This tutorial is an introduction to Android Fragments. You will learn the fundamental concepts of Android Fragments while creating an app that displays the rage comics.
title: Android Fragments Tutorial: An Introduction

description: Having ClassyShark show that problems exists is sometimes not enough, sometimes to continue the investigation you need all the ClassyShark data be exported at once.
title: Exporting data from ClassyShark

description: Two weeks ago, Jeremie Martinez and his team released a new feature with Firebase: Personal App Indexing. In beta testing he also noticed many complaints about app permissions.
title: Post-mortem : Firebase vs permissions

description: This article provides guidance for indie developers or small businesses who published their apps that use "dangerous permissions" and did not include a privacy policy in their app or on Google Play.
title: Did you get one of these Google Play Developer Policy Violation Emails?

description: Is annotation processing really supported in Kotlin? Yes / No / It’s complicated
title: Pushing the limits of Kotlin annotation processing

description: Here's a comparative look at push vs pull concepts in programming.
title: Pull vs Push & Imperative vs Reactive - Reactive Programming

description: Why did an architecture that makes testing difficult became the default way of building Android apps in the first place? The Philosophical Hacker ponders this question.
title: Why Android Testing is so Hard: Historical Edition

description: Since Android 7.0 Nougat you can’t expose a file:// URI with an Intent outside your package domain, but don’t worry: here’s how you can fix it.
title: Sharing files though Intents: are you ready for Nougat?

description: Download PDF Viewer to maximize productivity! Instant access to view, search, and annotate PDF documents with ease on your Android phone, tablet, or Chromebook. A seamless PDF experience, trusted by thousands of companies and developers throughout the world.
title: PSPDFKit - Free PDF Viewer 1.0 for Android

description: Bugsee is a bug & crash reporter for Android. Like a black box on an airplane, Bugsee records everything your app is doing. When a bug occurs, everything you need has already been recorded: video of users’ actions, network traffic & console logs. Android Weekly readers get 20% off on all tiers.
title: See video, network & logs leading up to bug/crash

description: But Google’s version of bottom navigation bars has a serious problem: mystery meat navigation. Teo Yu Siang looks at some issues with the Material Design nav bars.
title: Material Design & the Mystery Meat Navigation Problem

description: Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia, and as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Our Android app is core to our business. You’ll work on a product that’s evolved tremendously and still has room to grow.
title: Senior Android Developer

description: Are you an Android Nerd with a passion for developing solutions for challenging problems? At the Nerdery, you'll collaborate with other talented engineers developing best-in-class apps for a variety of clients. Check out one of our events or apply today!
title: Android Engineer - The Nerdery

description: The Blinkist app has been featured by the iTunes and Google Play Store numerous times. We are working with the latest tech and tools – our minSdkVersion is 16 - Jelly Bean. Our tech debt is minimal and our foundations are solid. To further improve ur Android app we need you to join our Berlin HQ.
title: Android Developer

description: At Streak, we're building the most automated and integrated CRM. We're hiring a curious mind to own development of our Android and(or) iOS Apps. This role will be responsible for building our Android app from the ground up while also pushing the envelope on our iOS app.
title: Android Mobile Lead @ Streak (yc s11)

description: We’re looking for a smart, creative and self motivated individual to join the Scoop team! You should thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and have 1+ years in a full-time Android/mobile development role. We're trying to fix traffic with carpooling, and we need your help! Great pay/benefits!
title: Android Engineer

description: A simple, animated progress loader inspired by an UpLabs challenge
title: SlidingSquaresLoader

description: This library intends to make JSON very easy to interact with in Java; it also makes (de)serialization painless.
title: Ason

description: An extensive tutorial on RxJava
title: Intro-To-RxJava

description: An in-app HTTP inspector for Android OkHttp clients
title: chuck

description: Plugin which generates Android Parcelable boilerplate code for kotlin's class.
title: android-parcelable-intellij-plugin-kotlin

description: The Android tools team released Android Studio 2.3 Beta 4 to the Canary and Dev Channels.
title: Android Studio 2.3 Beta 4 is now available

description: The Android tools team published ConstraintLayout beta 5. It will be the last beta before 1.0 and is considered as the release candidate.
title: ConstraintLayout beta 5 is now available

description: Google has released Developer Preview 2 (DP2) for Android Things, bringing new features and bug fixes to the platform.
title: Android Things Developer Preview 2

description: An overview for developers about new Android Wear 2.0 features, including material design, watch face complications and standalone functionalities.
title: Android Wear 2.0 for Developers

description: Three presentations from the NY Android Developers Meetup at Facebook, January 25, 2017
title: Jan 2017 Meetup: Annotations, Offline, Fingerprint Auth

description: In this episode, Chet and Tor talk with Alan Viverette and Chris Banes about random things about the Support Library: releases, AppCompat, drawables, Night mode, gradle, support lib modularization, and more.
title: Android Developers Backstage: It Depends

description: In this episode, the crew talk to Android developer Andrew Orobator. He gives us the lowdown on the new feature App Shortcuts that was introduced in Android.
title: App Shortcuts with Andrew Orobator

description: While in London for Droidcon, Huyen asks Ana Baotic all about her best practice for app security on Android.
title: Ana Baotic: Safety First

description: Utilising next generation technology to build immersive & intuitive experiences.
title: AppsWorld Evolution
